plant.configurations.unified_config¶

Source: src\plant\configurations\unified_config.py

Module Overview¶

Unified Configuration System for DIP Models.

Provides a centralized configuration management system that supports all DIP model types (simplified, full, low-rank) with factory patterns and automatic configuration selection.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#===================== src/plant/configurations/unified_config.py =====================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Unified Configuration System for DIP Models.
  7
  8Provides a centralized configuration management system that supports
  9all DIP model types (simplified, full, low-rank) with factory patterns
 10and automatic configuration selection.
 11"""
 12
 13from __future__ import annotations
 14from typing import Dict, Any, Union, Optional, Type
 15from enum import Enum
 16import warnings
 17
 18from .base_config import BaseDIPConfig, ConfigurationError, ConfigurationWarning
 19
 20
 21class DIPModelType(Enum):
 22    """Available DIP model types."""
 23    SIMPLIFIED = "simplified"
 24    FULL = "full"
 25    LOWRANK = "lowrank"
 26    CONTROLLER = "controller"
 27
 28
 29class ConfigurationFactory:
 30    """
 31    Factory for creating DIP configurations.
 32
 33    Provides centralized creation and management of configurations
 34    for different DIP model types with validation and consistency checking.
 35    """
 36
 37    # Registry of available configuration classes
 38    _config_registry: Dict[DIPModelType, Type[BaseDIPConfig]] = {}
 39
 40    @classmethod
 41    def register_config(cls, model_type: DIPModelType, config_class: Type[BaseDIPConfig]) -> None:
 42        """
 43        Register a configuration class for a model type.
 44
 45        Args:
 46            model_type: The model type this configuration supports
 47            config_class: The configuration class to register
 48        """
 49        cls._config_registry[model_type] = config_class
 50
 51    @classmethod
 52    def create_config(
 53        cls,
 54        model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str],
 55        config_dict: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
 56        **kwargs: Any
 57    ) -> BaseDIPConfig:
 58        """
 59        Create a configuration for the specified model type.
 60
 61        Args:
 62            model_type: Type of DIP model
 63            config_dict: Optional configuration dictionary
 64            **kwargs: Additional configuration parameters
 65
 66        Returns:
 67            Configured DIP configuration instance
 68
 69        Raises:
 70            ConfigurationError: If model type is not supported or configuration is invalid
 71        """
 72        # Convert string to enum if needed
 73        if isinstance(model_type, str):
 74            try:
 75                model_type = DIPModelType(model_type.lower())
 76            except ValueError:
 77                raise ConfigurationError(f"Unsupported model type: {model_type}")
 78
 79        # Get configuration class
 80        if model_type not in cls._config_registry:
 81            # Try to import and register the configuration class
 82            cls._lazy_import_config(model_type)
 83
 84        if model_type not in cls._config_registry:
 85            raise ConfigurationError(f"No configuration class registered for {model_type}")
 86
 87        config_class = cls._config_registry[model_type]
 88
 89        # Merge config_dict and kwargs
 90        if config_dict is None:
 91            config_dict = {}
 92        config_dict.update(kwargs)
 93
 94        try:
 95            if config_dict:
 96                return config_class.from_dict(config_dict)
 97            else:
 98                return config_class.create_default()
 99        except Exception as e:
100            raise ConfigurationError(f"Failed to create {model_type} configuration: {e}")
101
102    @classmethod
103    def create_default_config(cls, model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str]) -> BaseDIPConfig:
104        """Create default configuration for the specified model type."""
105        return cls.create_config(model_type)
106
107    @classmethod
108    def create_preset_config(
109        cls,
110        model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str],
111        preset_name: str
112    ) -> BaseDIPConfig:
113        """
114        Create a preset configuration.
115
116        Args:
117            model_type: Type of DIP model
118            preset_name: Name of the preset configuration
119
120        Returns:
121            Configured DIP configuration instance
122        """
123        preset_configs = cls._get_preset_configs()
124
125        if model_type not in preset_configs:
126            raise ConfigurationError(f"No presets available for {model_type}")
127
128        if preset_name not in preset_configs[model_type]:
129            available = list(preset_configs[model_type].keys())
130            raise ConfigurationError(f"Preset '{preset_name}' not found for {model_type}. Available: {available}")
131
132        preset_dict = preset_configs[model_type][preset_name]
133        return cls.create_config(model_type, preset_dict)
134
135    @classmethod
136    def get_available_presets(cls, model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str]) -> list[str]:
137        """Get list of available preset names for a model type."""
138        if isinstance(model_type, str):
139            model_type = DIPModelType(model_type.lower())
140
141        preset_configs = cls._get_preset_configs()
142        return list(preset_configs.get(model_type, {}).keys())
143
144    @classmethod
145    def compare_configurations(
146        cls,
147        config1: BaseDIPConfig,
148        config2: BaseDIPConfig
149    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
150        """
151        Compare two configurations and return differences.
152
153        Args:
154            config1: First configuration
155            config2: Second configuration
156
157        Returns:
158            Dictionary with comparison results
159        """
160        dict1 = config1.to_dict()
161        dict2 = config2.to_dict()
162
163        differences = {}
164        all_keys = set(dict1.keys()) | set(dict2.keys())
165
166        for key in all_keys:
167            val1 = dict1.get(key, "NOT_PRESENT")
168            val2 = dict2.get(key, "NOT_PRESENT")
169
170            if val1 != val2:
171                differences[key] = {
172                    'config1': val1,
173                    'config2': val2
174                }
175
176        return {
177            'differences': differences,
178            'num_differences': len(differences),
179            'config1_type': type(config1).__name__,
180            'config2_type': type(config2).__name__
181        }
182
183    @classmethod
184    def validate_configuration(cls, config: BaseDIPConfig) -> Dict[str, Any]:
185        """
186        Comprehensive validation of a configuration.
187
188        Args:
189            config: Configuration to validate
190
191        Returns:
192            Dictionary with validation results
193        """
194        validation_results = {
195            'is_valid': True,
196            'errors': [],
197            'warnings': [],
198            'consistency_checks': {},
199            'physical_parameters': {},
200            'numerical_parameters': {},
201            'system_scales': {}
202        }
203
204        try:
205            # Basic validation
206            validation_results['is_valid'] = config.validate()
207
208            # Consistency checks
209            validation_results['consistency_checks'] = config.check_physical_consistency()
210
211            # Parameter extraction
212            validation_results['physical_parameters'] = config.get_physical_parameters()
213            validation_results['numerical_parameters'] = config.get_numerical_parameters()
214
215            # System scales
216            validation_results['system_scales'] = config.get_system_scales()
217
218            # Check for warnings
219            failed_checks = [k for k, v in validation_results['consistency_checks'].items() if not v]
220            if failed_checks:
221                validation_results['warnings'].append(f"Failed consistency checks: {failed_checks}")
222
223        except Exception as e:
224            validation_results['is_valid'] = False
225            validation_results['errors'].append(str(e))
226
227        return validation_results
228
229    @classmethod
230    def _lazy_import_config(cls, model_type: DIPModelType) -> None:
231        """Lazy import configuration classes."""
232        try:
233            if model_type == DIPModelType.SIMPLIFIED:
234                from ..models.simplified.config import SimplifiedDIPConfig
235                cls.register_config(DIPModelType.SIMPLIFIED, SimplifiedDIPConfig)
236
237            elif model_type == DIPModelType.FULL:
238                from ..models.full.config import FullDIPConfig
239                cls.register_config(DIPModelType.FULL, FullDIPConfig)
240
241            elif model_type == DIPModelType.LOWRANK:
242                from ..models.lowrank.config import LowRankDIPConfig
243                cls.register_config(DIPModelType.LOWRANK, LowRankDIPConfig)
244
245            elif model_type == DIPModelType.CONTROLLER:
246                # Import controller configuration class
247                cls._import_controller_config()
248
249        except ImportError as e:
250            warnings.warn(f"Could not import configuration for {model_type}: {e}", ConfigurationWarning)
251
252    @classmethod
253    def _import_controller_config(cls) -> None:
254        """Import controller configuration class."""
255        try:
256            from .controller_config import ControllerConfiguration
257            cls.register_config(DIPModelType.CONTROLLER, ControllerConfiguration)
258        except ImportError:
259            # Create a basic controller config if the full one doesn't exist
260            from .base_config import BaseDIPConfig
261
262            class BasicControllerConfig(BaseDIPConfig):
263                def __init__(self, **kwargs):
264                    # Default controller settings
265                    defaults = {
266                        'max_force': 150.0,
267                        'dt': 0.001,
268                        'boundary_layer': 0.02,
269                        'classical_smc_gains': [5.0, 5.0, 5.0, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5],
270                        'adaptive_smc_gains': [10.0, 8.0, 5.0, 4.0, 1.0],
271                        'sta_smc_gains': [5.0, 3.0, 4.0, 4.0, 0.4, 0.4]
272                    }
273                    defaults.update(kwargs)
274                    for key, value in defaults.items():
275                        setattr(self, key, value)
276
277                def validate(self) -> bool:
278                    return True
279
280                def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
281                    return {k: v for k, v in self.__dict__.items() if not k.startswith('_')}
282
283                @classmethod
284                def from_dict(cls, config_dict: Dict[str, Any]) -> 'BasicControllerConfig':
285                    return cls(**config_dict)
286
287                @classmethod
288                def create_default(cls) -> 'BasicControllerConfig':
289                    return cls()
290
291                def get_physical_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
292                    return {'max_force': getattr(self, 'max_force', 150.0)}
293
294                def get_numerical_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
295                    return {'dt': getattr(self, 'dt', 0.001), 'boundary_layer': getattr(self, 'boundary_layer', 0.02)}
296
297                def check_physical_consistency(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
298                    return {'max_force_positive': getattr(self, 'max_force', 150.0) > 0}
299
300                def get_system_scales(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
301                    return {'force_scale': getattr(self, 'max_force', 150.0)}
302
303            cls.register_config(DIPModelType.CONTROLLER, BasicControllerConfig)
304
305    @classmethod
306    def _get_preset_configs(cls) -> Dict[DIPModelType, Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]]:
307        """Get preset configuration dictionaries."""
308        return {
309            DIPModelType.SIMPLIFIED: {
310                'default': {
311                    'cart_mass': 1.0,
312                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
313                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
314                    'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
315                    'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
316                    'gravity': 9.81,
317                },
318                'educational': {
319                    'cart_mass': 1.0,
320                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.2,
321                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.15,
322                    'pendulum1_length': 1.0,
323                    'pendulum2_length': 0.8,
324                    'gravity': 9.81,
325                },
326                'lightweight': {
327                    'cart_mass': 0.5,
328                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.05,
329                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.05,
330                    'pendulum1_length': 0.3,
331                    'pendulum2_length': 0.3,
332                    'gravity': 9.81,
333                }
334            },
335            DIPModelType.FULL: {
336                'default': {
337                    'cart_mass': 1.0,
338                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
339                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
340                    'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
341                    'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
342                    'pendulum1_com': 0.25,
343                    'pendulum2_com': 0.25,
344                    'gravity': 9.81,
345                },
346                'research': {
347                    'cart_mass': 2.0,
348                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.3,
349                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.2,
350                    'pendulum1_length': 0.8,
351                    'pendulum2_length': 0.6,
352                    'pendulum1_com': 0.4,
353                    'pendulum2_com': 0.3,
354                    'gravity': 9.81,
355                },
356                'high_precision': {
357                    'cart_mass': 1.0,
358                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
359                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
360                    'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
361                    'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
362                    'pendulum1_com': 0.25,
363                    'pendulum2_com': 0.25,
364                    'gravity': 9.81,
365                }
366            },
367            DIPModelType.LOWRANK: {
368                'default': {
369                    'cart_mass': 1.0,
370                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
371                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
372                    'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
373                    'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
374                    'gravity': 9.81,
375                    'enable_linearization': True,
376                },
377                'fast_prototype': {
378                    'cart_mass': 1.0,
379                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.1,
380                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
381                    'pendulum1_length': 0.5,
382                    'pendulum2_length': 0.5,
383                    'gravity': 9.81,
384                    'enable_linearization': True,
385                    'enable_small_angle_approximation': True,
386                    'enable_fast_math': True,
387                },
388                'educational': {
389                    'cart_mass': 1.0,
390                    'pendulum1_mass': 0.2,
391                    'pendulum2_mass': 0.1,
392                    'pendulum1_length': 1.0,
393                    'pendulum2_length': 0.8,
394                    'gravity': 9.81,
395                    'enable_linearization': False,
396                    'enable_small_angle_approximation': False,
397                }
398            }
399        }
400
401
402class UnifiedConfiguration:
403    """
404    Unified configuration management for all DIP models.
405
406    Provides a single interface for configuration management across
407    different model types with automatic model selection and validation.
408    """
409
410    def __init__(
411        self,
412        model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str],
413        config: Optional[Union[BaseDIPConfig, Dict[str, Any]]] = None
414    ):
415        """
416        Initialize unified configuration.
417
418        Args:
419            model_type: Type of DIP model
420            config: Configuration instance or dictionary
421        """
422        self.model_type = DIPModelType(model_type) if isinstance(model_type, str) else model_type
423
424        if config is None:
425            self.config = ConfigurationFactory.create_default_config(self.model_type)
426        elif isinstance(config, dict):
427            self.config = ConfigurationFactory.create_config(self.model_type, config)
428        elif isinstance(config, BaseDIPConfig):
429            self.config = config
430        else:
431            raise ConfigurationError(f"Invalid configuration type: {type(config)}")
432
433    def validate(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
434        """Validate the current configuration."""
435        return ConfigurationFactory.validate_configuration(self.config)
436
437    def update(self, **kwargs: Any) -> None:
438        """Update configuration parameters."""
439        current_dict = self.config.to_dict()
440        current_dict.update(kwargs)
441        self.config = ConfigurationFactory.create_config(self.model_type, current_dict)
442
443    def compare_with(self, other: Union['UnifiedConfiguration', BaseDIPConfig]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
444        """Compare with another configuration."""
445        if isinstance(other, UnifiedConfiguration):
446            other_config = other.config
447        else:
448            other_config = other
449
450        return ConfigurationFactory.compare_configurations(self.config, other_config)
451
452    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
453        """Convert to dictionary."""
454        return {
455            'model_type': self.model_type.value,
456            'config': self.config.to_dict()
457        }
458
459    @classmethod
460    def from_dict(cls, config_dict: Dict[str, Any]) -> 'UnifiedConfiguration':
461        """Create from dictionary."""
462        model_type = config_dict['model_type']
463        config = config_dict['config']
464        return cls(model_type, config)
465
466    def get_system_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
467        """Get comprehensive system information."""
468        validation = self.validate()
469        return {
470            'model_type': self.model_type.value,
471            'configuration_class': type(self.config).__name__,
472            'is_valid': validation['is_valid'],
473            'physical_parameters': validation['physical_parameters'],
474            'numerical_parameters': validation['numerical_parameters'],
475            'system_scales': validation['system_scales'],
476            'consistency_checks': validation['consistency_checks']
477        }

Classes¶

DIPModelType¶

Available DIP model types.

Source Code¶

1class DIPModelType(Enum):
2    """Available DIP model types."""
3    SIMPLIFIED = "simplified"
4    FULL = "full"
5    LOWRANK = "lowrank"
6    CONTROLLER = "controller"

ConfigurationFactory¶

Factory for creating DIP configurations.

Provides centralized creation and management of configurations for different DIP model types with validation and consistency checking.

Source Code¶

  1class ConfigurationFactory:
  2    """
  3    Factory for creating DIP configurations.
  4
  5    Provides centralized creation and management of configurations
  6    for different DIP model types with validation and consistency checking.
  7    """
  8
  9    # Registry of available configuration classes
 10    _config_registry: Dict[DIPModelType, Type[BaseDIPConfig]] = {}
 11
 12    @classmethod
 13    def register_config(cls, model_type: DIPModelType, config_class: Type[BaseDIPConfig]) -> None:
 14        """
 15        Register a configuration class for a model type.
 16
 17        Args:
 18            model_type: The model type this configuration supports
 19            config_class: The configuration class to register
 20        """
 21        cls._config_registry[model_type] = config_class
 22
 23    @classmethod
 24    def create_config(
 25        cls,
 26        model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str],
 27        config_dict: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
 28        **kwargs: Any
 29    ) -> BaseDIPConfig:
 30        """
 31        Create a configuration for the specified model type.
 32
 33        Args:
 34            model_type: Type of DIP model
 35            config_dict: Optional configuration dictionary
 36            **kwargs: Additional configuration parameters
 37
 38        Returns:
 39            Configured DIP configuration instance
 40
 41        Raises:
 42            ConfigurationError: If model type is not supported or configuration is invalid
 43        """
 44        # Convert string to enum if needed
 45        if isinstance(model_type, str):
 46            try:
 47                model_type = DIPModelType(model_type.lower())
 48            except ValueError:
 49                raise ConfigurationError(f"Unsupported model type: {model_type}")
 50
 51        # Get configuration class
 52        if model_type not in cls._config_registry:
 53            # Try to import and register the configuration class
 54            cls._lazy_import_config(model_type)
 55
 56        if model_type not in cls._config_registry:
 57            raise ConfigurationError(f"No configuration class registered for {model_type}")
 58
 59        config_class = cls._config_registry[model_type]
 60
 61        # Merge config_dict and kwargs
 62        if config_dict is None:
 63            config_dict = {}
 64        config_dict.update(kwargs)
 65
 66        try:
 67            if config_dict:
 68                return config_class.from_dict(config_dict)
 69            else:
 70                return config_class.create_default()
 71        except Exception as e:
 72            raise ConfigurationError(f"Failed to create {model_type} configuration: {e}")
 73
 74    @classmethod
 75    def create_default_config(cls, model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str]) -> BaseDIPConfig:
 76        """Create default configuration for the specified model type."""
 77        return cls.create_config(model_type)
 78
 79    @classmethod
 80    def create_preset_config(
 81        cls,
 82        model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str],
 83        preset_name: str
 84    ) -> BaseDIPConfig:
 85        """
 86        Create a preset configuration.
 87
 88        Args:
 89            model_type: Type of DIP model
 90            preset_name: Name of the preset configuration
 91
 92        Returns:
 93            Configured DIP configuration instance
 94        """
 95        preset_configs = cls._get_preset_configs()
 96
 97        if model_type not in preset_configs:
 98            raise ConfigurationError(f"No presets available for {model_type}")
 99
100        if preset_name not in preset_configs[model_type]:
101            available = list(preset_configs[model_type].keys())
102            raise ConfigurationError(f"Preset '{preset_name}' not found for {model_type}. Available: {available}")
103
104        preset_dict = preset_configs[model_type][preset_name]
105        return cls.create_config(model_type, preset_dict)
106
107    @classmethod
108    def get_available_presets(cls, model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str]) -> list[str]:
109        """Get list of available preset names for a model type."""
110        if isinstance(model_type, str):
111            model_type = DIPModelType(model_type.lower())
112
113        preset_configs = cls._get_preset_configs()
114        return list(preset_configs.get(model_type, {}).keys())
115
116    @classmethod
117    def compare_configurations(
118        cls,
119        config1: BaseDIPConfig,
120        config2: BaseDIPConfig
121    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
122        """
123        Compare two configurations and return differences.
124
125        Args:
126            config1: First configuration
127            config2: Second configuration
128
129        Returns:
130            Dictionary with comparison results
131        """
132        dict1 = config1.to_dict()
133        dict2 = config2.to_dict()
134
135        differences = {}
136        all_keys = set(dict1.keys()) | set(dict2.keys())
137
138        for key in all_keys:
139            val1 = dict1.get(key, "NOT_PRESENT")
140            val2 = dict2.get(key, "NOT_PRESENT")
141
142            if val1 != val2:
143                differences[key] = {
144                    'config1': val1,
145                    'config2': val2
146                }
147
148        return {
149            'differences': differences,
150            'num_differences': len(differences),
151            'config1_type': type(config1).__name__,
152            'config2_type': type(config2).__name__
153        }
154
155    @classmethod
156    def validate_configuration(cls, config: BaseDIPConfig) -> Dict[str, Any]:
157        """
158        Comprehensive validation of a configuration.
159
160        Args:
161            config: Configuration to validate
162
163        Returns:
164            Dictionary with validation results
165        """
166        validation_results = {
167            'is_valid': True,
168            'errors': [],
169            'warnings': [],
170            'consistency_checks': {},
171            'physical_parameters': {},
172            'numerical_parameters': {},
173            'system_scales': {}
174        }
175
176        try:
177            # Basic validation
178            validation_results['is_valid'] = config.validate()
179
180            # Consistency checks
181            validation_results['consistency_checks'] = config.check_physical_consistency()
182
183            # Parameter extraction
184            validation_results['physical_parameters'] = config.get_physical_parameters()
185            validation_results['numerical_parameters'] = config.get_numerical_parameters()
186
187            # System scales
188            validation_results['system_scales'] = config.get_system_scales()
189
190            # Check for warnings
191            failed_checks = [k for k, v in validation_results['consistency_checks'].items() if not v]
192            if failed_checks:
193                validation_results['warnings'].append(f"Failed consistency checks: {failed_checks}")
194
195        except Exception as e:
196            validation_results['is_valid'] = False
197            validation_results['errors'].append(str(e))
198
199        return validation_results
200
201    @classmethod
202    def _lazy_import_config(cls, model_type: DIPModelType) -> None:
203        """Lazy import configuration classes."""
204        try:
205            if model_type == DIPModelType.SIMPLIFIED:
206                from ..models.simplified.config import SimplifiedDIPConfig
207                cls.register_config(DIPModelType.SIMPLIFIED, SimplifiedDIPConfig)
208
209            elif model_type == DIPModelType.FULL:
210                from ..models.full.config import FullDIPConfig
211                cls.register_config(DIPModelType.FULL, FullDIPConfig)
212
213            elif model_type == DIPModelType.LOWRANK:
214                from ..models.lowrank.config import LowRankDIPConfig
215                cls.register_config(DIPModelType.LOWRANK, LowRankDIPConfig)
216
217            elif model_type == DIPModelType.CONTROLLER:
218                # Import controller configuration class
219                cls._import_controller_config()
220
221        except ImportError as e:
222            warnings.warn(f"Could not import configuration for {model_type}: {e}", ConfigurationWarning)
223
224    @classmethod
225    def _import_controller_config(cls) -> None:
226        """Import controller configuration class."""
227        try:
228            from .controller_config import ControllerConfiguration
229            cls.register_config(DIPModelType.CONTROLLER, ControllerConfiguration)
230        except ImportError:
231            # Create a basic controller config if the full one doesn't exist
232            from .base_config import BaseDIPConfig
233
234            class BasicControllerConfig(BaseDIPConfig):
235                def __init__(self, **kwargs):
236                    # Default controller settings
237                    defaults = {
238                        'max_force': 150.0,
239                        'dt': 0.001,
240                        'boundary_layer': 0.02,
241                        'classical_smc_gains': [5.0, 5.0, 5.0, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5],
242                        'adaptive_smc_gains': [10.0, 8.0, 5.0, 4.0, 1.0],
243                        'sta_smc_gains': [5.0, 3.0, 4.0, 4.0, 0.4, 0.4]
244                    }
245                    defaults.update(kwargs)
246                    for key, value in defaults.items():
247                        setattr(self, key, value)
248
249                def validate(self) -> bool:
250                    return True
251
252                def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
253                    return {k: v for k, v in self.__dict__.items() if not k.startswith('_')}
254
255                @classmethod
256                def from_dict(cls, config_dict: Dict[str, Any]) -> 'BasicControllerConfig':
257                    return cls(**config_dict)
258
259                @classmethod
260                def create_default(cls) -> 'BasicControllerConfig':
261                    return cls()
262
263                def get_physical_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
264                    return {'max_force': getattr(self, 'max_force', 150.0)}
265
266                def get_numerical_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
267                    return {'dt': getattr(self, 'dt', 0.001), 'boundary_layer': getattr(self, 'boundary_layer', 0.02)}
268
269                def check_physical_consistency(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
270                    return {'max_force_positive': getattr(self, 'max_force', 150.0) > 0}
271
272                def get_system_scales(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
273                    return {'force_scale': getattr(self, 'max_force', 150.0)}
274
275            cls.register_config(DIPModelType.CONTROLLER, BasicControllerConfig)
276
277    @classmethod
278    def _get_preset_configs(cls) -> Dict[DIPModelType, Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]]:
279        """Get preset configuration dictionaries."""
280        return {
281            DIPModelType.SIMPLIFIED: {

UnifiedConfiguration¶

Unified configuration management for all DIP models.

Provides a single interface for configuration management across different model types with automatic model selection and validation.

Source Code¶

 1class UnifiedConfiguration:
 2    """
 3    Unified configuration management for all DIP models.
 4
 5    Provides a single interface for configuration management across
 6    different model types with automatic model selection and validation.
 7    """
 8
 9    def __init__(
10        self,
11        model_type: Union[DIPModelType, str],
12        config: Optional[Union[BaseDIPConfig, Dict[str, Any]]] = None
13    ):
14        """
15        Initialize unified configuration.
16
17        Args:
18            model_type: Type of DIP model
19            config: Configuration instance or dictionary
20        """
21        self.model_type = DIPModelType(model_type) if isinstance(model_type, str) else model_type
22
23        if config is None:
24            self.config = ConfigurationFactory.create_default_config(self.model_type)
25        elif isinstance(config, dict):
26            self.config = ConfigurationFactory.create_config(self.model_type, config)
27        elif isinstance(config, BaseDIPConfig):
28            self.config = config
29        else:
30            raise ConfigurationError(f"Invalid configuration type: {type(config)}")
31
32    def validate(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
33        """Validate the current configuration."""
34        return ConfigurationFactory.validate_configuration(self.config)
35
36    def update(self, **kwargs: Any) -> None:
37        """Update configuration parameters."""
38        current_dict = self.config.to_dict()
39        current_dict.update(kwargs)
40        self.config = ConfigurationFactory.create_config(self.model_type, current_dict)
41
42    def compare_with(self, other: Union['UnifiedConfiguration', BaseDIPConfig]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
43        """Compare with another configuration."""
44        if isinstance(other, UnifiedConfiguration):
45            other_config = other.config
46        else:
47            other_config = other
48
49        return ConfigurationFactory.compare_configurations(self.config, other_config)
50
51    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
52        """Convert to dictionary."""
53        return {
54            'model_type': self.model_type.value,
55            'config': self.config.to_dict()
56        }
57
58    @classmethod
59    def from_dict(cls, config_dict: Dict[str, Any]) -> 'UnifiedConfiguration':
60        """Create from dictionary."""
61        model_type = config_dict['model_type']
62        config = config_dict['config']
63        return cls(model_type, config)
64
65    def get_system_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
66        """Get comprehensive system information."""
67        validation = self.validate()
68        return {
69            'model_type': self.model_type.value,
70            'configuration_class': type(self.config).__name__,
71            'is_valid': validation['is_valid'],
72            'physical_parameters': validation['physical_parameters'],
73            'numerical_parameters': validation['numerical_parameters'],
74            'system_scales': validation['system_scales'],
75            'consistency_checks': validation['consistency_checks']
76        }
